intro: [WRONG START] Cirsium homolephis, commonly known as the Japanese thistle, is a perennial plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and large, purple-pink flower heads. The plant has deeply lobed, hairy leaves that are often covered in stiff bristles. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
